posts.post_content:
@ blindthrall   
I agree, but we can't all have what we want.   
  
if we always got the cards that could fit into every format, we'd just be playing 4 sets of Magic 2012 in each block and whatnot: That's the set where standard, normal, "can be put into many decks" kind of cards come from. It's the base which a block uses to support their own strategies and styles.  
  
Mind you, This is in no rights a good card, and it shouldn't have had such a high CMC. 4 may have been acceptable.   
  
1/5.
posts.html:
@ blindthrall
I agree, but we can't all have what we want.

if we always got the cards that could fit into every format, we'd just be playing 4 sets of Magic 2012 in each block and whatnot: That's the set where standard, normal, "can be put into many decks" kind of cards come from. It's the base which a block uses to support their own strategies and styles.

Mind you, This is in no rights a good card, and it shouldn't have had such a high CMC. 4 may have been acceptable.

1/5.

Posted By: Ferlord (4/23/2012 10:21:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: There is so much better creature removal in standard right now: [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade), [Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat), [Victim of Night](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Victim of Night), [Rebuke](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rebuke). Even pseudo-removal like [Claustrophobia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Claustrophobia) and [Pacifism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pacifism) outshine this. And did they really have to make it a sorcery?
posts.html:
There is so much better creature removal in standard right now: Doom Blade, Go for the Throat, Victim of Night, Rebuke. Even pseudo-removal like Claustrophobia and Pacifism outshine this. And did they really have to make it a sorcery?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: TheAdversary (2/20/2012 9:04:49 AM)
Rating:

@TheAdversary

Still, it is nice to have something that has not requirements at all. This still isn't as good as Sever the Bloodline, and the cost makes this almost impossible to put in despite its lack of restrictions. But I just love matches with my Zombie constructed deck when I find out the opponent put a multiple copies of Doom Blade and Victim of Night in their deck.

A little bit of tweaking and this might actually be playable; 1 less cost, as an instant would do it for me at least.

posts.post_content: Latest entry from the template 5-mana common mono-black sorceries that can destroy black creatures and then maybe get a bonus. Also compare with [Gloomlance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gloomlance) and [Spread the Sickness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spread the Sickness).

posts.post_content:
Meh.  
This card would be even less well received if Limited formats didn't exist.  
At that cost and sorcery speed, this is too ridiculous to use in any constructed format  
(maybe EDH if you just *really* need another kill spell?).  
  
Vastly inferior to [Sever the Bloodline](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sever the Bloodline), *from the same block*.  
I get that it's common and shouldn't be as good,   
but look at [Tragic Slip](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tragic Slip) and tell me this isn't garbage in the same set, rarity, and color.  
  
@NoobOfLore- you are forgetting cards that let you destroy \*any\* permanent, or exile creatures.  
Off the top of my head, this is utter trash compared to [Vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vindicate), [Maelstrom Pulse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maelstrom Pulse), [Mortify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mortify), [Putrefy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrefy), [Wrecking Ball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrecking Ball), [Unmake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unmake), and the Standard-legal [Beast Within](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Beast Within) and Sever the Bloodline, which, as I mentioned before, is from the same block, costs 1 less, EXILES, and can p...
